newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: SFE wheat falls on Chicago, uninfluenced by ABARE.
newsitem.headline: SFE wheat falls on Chicago, uninfluenced by ABARE.

text.p: Sydney Futures Exchange wheat futures fell on Tuesday following Chicago's overnight decline.
The January 1998 contract traded at A$171.50 a tonne, down A$3 on with the previous settlement close, with 25 lots changing hands. Settlement prices of most contracts fell by about A$3.

Chicago had a bigger impact on the Sydney market than the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE) forecast, released 30 minutes before the wheat futures floor market closed, cutting its forecast of Australia's 1997/98 wheat crop to 16.2 million tonnes from 19.2 million tonnes.
